definition[0]: to say hello to someone or welcome them
example[1]: Bill opened the door to Harold and greeted him with cries of welcome.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually use say hello (to somebody) rather than greet somebody:
definition[1]: to react to something in a particular way
example[2]: His statement was greeted with cries of astonishment and indignation.
explanation[1]: Greet is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to be the first thing you see or hear when you arrive somewhere
example[3]: Complete silence greeted us as we entered the room.
